identifier.identifierName: Contract: VA118-16-D-1008, Task Order (TO): VA-118-16-F-1008-0007, CLIN0005AL

title.value: Women's Health: Reproductive Health Documentation Template

description.value: The Women's Health: Reproductive Health Documentation Template is intended for users caring for women of reproductive age to provide guidance and allow for the efficient documentation of reproductive status, pregnancy and lactation status, pregnancy intentions, and method of pregnancy avoidance.

prompt.value: Do you want to become pregnant within the next year?
Provide link to Preconception Counseling KNART if available.

title.value: Same Day Start Criteria for Contraceptives

prompt.value: Criteria for beginning immediate contraception (to include ring, patch, pill or the injectable

displayText.value: First day of the last menstrual period (LMP) occurred less than or equal to 7 days ago
No intercourse since start of the LMP

title.value: Review with patient the contraceptive options and the associated levels of effectiveness of those methods.

prompt.value: Permanent methods (less than 1 pregnancy per year among 100 women with typical use)

code.code: [409073007 |Education (procedure)] ->(363702006 |Has focus (attribute))->[bc795a70-3a23-46d4-a627-d5a891f03c1b |Bilateral occlusion of fallopian tubes using intrafallopian implants (procedure)]

prompt.value: Highly effective methods (1 or fewer pregnancies per year among 100 women with typical use)
Very effective methods (about 5 pregnancies per year among 100 women with typical use)
Less effective methods (about 15 to 32 pregnancies per year among 100 women with typical use)

displayText.value: Natural family planning (e.g., lactational, amenorrhea, rhythm, calendar, or cervical mucus methods)

title.value: Review with patient emergency contraceptives in case of unprotected sex.

prompt.value: Emergency contraceptive (less than 1 pregnancy per year among 100 women if used within 72 hours)

title.value: If appropriate, address sexually transmitted infection risk reduction with use of barrier methods.

prompt.value: Sexually transmitted infection risk reduction plan?
